Armed with their trusty Gunwerks rifles, they navigate the rugged terrain, determined to get close to these elusive creatures amidst the stunning and challenging landscape.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in the final stretch of completing the South America Upland Slam. Having already checked off nine species in Argentina, he now finds himself in Peru, where he faces the challenge of tracking down two elusive species to complete his list: the Andean Tinamou and the Western Peruvian Dove.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he continues his hunting adventure in the stunning landscapes of Maasai Land, Tanzania. Mark moves to a different camp in this episode to pursue a Gerenuk, known for its long neck and unique browsing habits. He soon after turns his attention to the East African Impala.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he heads to Kentucky for the late muzzleloader season. Already having an unforgettable season so far after taking Freak Show back in early September, he is looking to cap off his Kentucky season with a great buck with his Muzzleloader.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he ventures into Croatias wild heart, hot on the trail of a legendary stag. In the midst of the rutting seasons deafening roars, tensions escalate as Mark closes the distance.Equipped with his Gunwerks 7LRM, things get dicey as Mark is face to face with a roaring stag at 12 yards!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is south of the border in Veracruz, Mexico going after a Mexican Gulf Coast Whitetail. When the whitetail action slowed down, Mark tried his luck at a spot-and stalk hunt for White-lipped Peccary. With hot temps, Mark and company try to find water that the Peccary will be targeting to stay hydrated.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark continues his quest in Croatia, and on the third day, they decide to venture to the coast where he will pursue his hunt on one of the numerous islands that permit hunting (Dugi Otok Island). Armedwith his trusted Gunwerks 7LRM Rifle, Mark prepares to stalk the diverse array of exotic animals inhabiting these islands, offering him a rich selection of prey to choose from.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in Ethiopia hunting Mountain Nyala. After the first two days, Mark has taken a Meneliks Bushbuck and a Colobus Monkey but no Mountain Nyala. Finally, on Day 3 the hunting party receives the green light from the military to hunt in the area they wanted. It's time to put the Gunwerks rifle to the test.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP heads to Lake Simcoe for some late Spring, post spawn Yellow Perch fishing action.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP targets the Kawartha Lakes region of Ontario, looking for post spawn Walleye opportunities.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP flies to British Columbia to tackle 4 fisheries using 4 different techniques targeting some of the regions popular species.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: Deep in the heart of the Darien Jungle is the first annual Pirate Tournament taking place at Tropic Star Lodge.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Join WoodHaven's Mike Pentecost as he kicks off his Alabama turkey season - these mountain birds are tough to hunt!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: WoodHavens Josh Anderson heads to the Western Plains of Kansas in pursuit of a mature whitetail buck. Because of the wide open terrain, a decoy and blind calling can be very affective because of the visibility. After a few well-timed grunts on the Intimidator grunt call, a shooter buck shows up right at the base of the tree!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: A heaven sent early morning turkey hunt with Colten and Mark Scroggins. The Apex Turkey Ninja TSS will make you a believer in killing turkeys with a .410!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mark Scroggins and his family are in Oklahoma and spot a big gobbler from the road. They are pretty sure they can get in position to call him in but they have to be quick without being seen. His step-daughter Destiny is behind the trigger and Mark just about puts this ol gobbler in her lap!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten Scroggins and the whole family return to the blind to see if they can call one of the other gobblers back in to their setup. A family that hunts together stays together!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike and Jacob are hunting an old turkey "Meanie" they have some history with on public land. Mike demos the WoodHaven box call clip.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stopsgetting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Callto turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike tries to hold his own while fishing with Nick Fischer and Liza Fitzgerald in south seas Captiva. Good luck buddy.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to the plantation on Crystal River to fish with Dallas King For trout and redfish.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Part one of Mike and Beth's adventure to Costa Rica's Zancudo Lodge.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Part two of the Zancudo adventure. Mike and Beth fish for Mahi, Sailfish and Cubera Snapper.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA fishes with Richard Black in Islamorada. This guy can do it all. Rain or shine, no fish is safe.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA takes his Son Cam to the Sports Coast for some friendly Father Son competition.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: How do you catch a persnickety Redfish? One bite at a time.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: C.A. heads to Apalachicola for a mixed bag of redfish and fresh oyster.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captains Jonathan Moss and Chris Shultz head offshore out of Mayport, Florida in search of massive Red Snapper!

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt Jonathan Moss is inshore fishing his home waters of the Northern Indian River Lagoon with Capt. Ian Ritchie!

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captains Jonathan Moss and Chris Argiro head out of Bonita Springs, Florida looking for schooled up Permit on wrecks and reefs.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss looks back at some memorable entries from Season 6 of The Captains Log.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Georgia, where we stop in Helen, Alpharetta and Atlanta!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through South Carolina, where we stop in Clemson, Travelers Rest and Charleston!!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Lindsey from The Lindsey Way is on a mission for one deer a buck they call Junior. After passing him the year before, Jeff spends months trying to catch up with the elusive whitetail. He makes mistakes, second-guesses himself, and faces plenty of close calls. But exactly one year to the day after letting Junior walk, Jeff climbs back into the same stand and this time, it all comes together.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mark and Lisa have a big flock of Rio turkeys right off the roost but have to make a bold move in the Oklahoma winds to get in on this big gobbler.
Kris Seymour chases big whitetails in NE Kansas!

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: The West Texas desert has a way of pulling you in. In Desert Ghost, Will Cooper heads west to Marathon, Texas, with longtime friend and mentor Cody Roberts to hunt aoudad in one of the most remote landscapes in the state. Rooted in family legacy, this film explores Codys deep ties to the desert, the story behind Desert Ghost Distillery, and the mystique of a western oasis near Big Bend National Park. More than a hunt, Desert Ghost dives into the role of aoudad management and its importance to desert bighorn sheep conservation efforts led by Texas Parks and Wildlife and the Wild Sheep Foundation. Sometimes, to protect what belongs here you have to chase the ghosts. You really do have to be tough, determined, or one lucky bastard to make it out in West Texas.

programme.title: The Bearded Buck
programme.desc: Jerry and Austin are hunting turkey on their home turf in Pennsylvania where they are later joined by the Sharp brothers and David "Bunch" Hale in hopes of truly having a season to remember!

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: Rochelle Partridge heads out after a monster framed buck, and when finally presented with an opportunity, anything could happen.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Waterfowl crew heads to Arkansas to hunt mallards in the timber. Rusty Creasey hosts Tyler and Colton Jordan, and Cole Barthel for an epic duck hunt.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Enjoy this weeks video as Cole Barthel and our friends from Browning hunt Louisiana. Despite poor conditions and stale ducks, the guys are able to scratch out a quick limit.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Part II of our exclusive profile of the current state of hunting in America and whether or not we believe there is light at the end of the tunnel.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson finds himself deep in the heart of Peru and focuses on completing the prestigious South America Upland Slam. With only one bird remaining, the Western Peruvian Dove, the trip has led him to a private hunting property. This final challenge will take place over a cut cornfield, a favorite spot for the doves. To blend in, Mark and his team craft a makeshift blind using a mix of corn stalks, and timber, just enough cover while allowing for a clear shot. These West Peruvian Doves are known for their erratic flight patterns, often bouncing from one tree to another in a random manner, making timing and placement critical.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: With over 20 years of service, retiring as a Senior Chief Machinery Technician, Steven served abord multiple Coast Guard cutters, led critical missions, protected our nation's leaders, and earned the Coast Guard Achievement Medal for his outstanding service. Beyond the uniform, Steven has has spent decades giving back - coaching youth sports, mentoring young athletes, and living the values of service, leadership, and integrity. Steven's dedication didn't end with retirement - and neither does our gratitude. We were honored to have Steven at Thumbtack Ranch and are even more grateful for his service.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true? We also take you on some great hunts weve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like. We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and part of the old Trained Assassins Crew, Luke Mitchell (producer) and Ryan Wascom (host), head out to Colorado to chase bugling elk with their bows. Also joining the crew is one of Slades real estate clients and his son. Part of the deal when this client worked with Slade was that Slade lined them up an elk hunt the following fall. It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: Meet Ryan, a seasoned St. Petersburg guide, fighting tides, time, and the last great tarpon run of the season.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: Meet Captain Lionel James a respected Destin, Florida guide known for his upbeat personality, strong community ties, and love for fitness when hes not on the water.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: Hes the original fishing coach. From the helm of one of the most iconic inshore shows ever made, Captain C.A. Richardson has taught a generation how to fish. This documentary dives into his story. The man, the mission, and the waters that made him who he is.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: LBP Spotlights Internet Personality and YouTube Star Lawson Lindsey as he searches for trophy fish at the Headwaters of the Loxahatchee River.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade and Caleb head back to Missouri to catch the end of bow season,and the start of rifle. Slade arrows a great buck (twice), and we preview the latest property Slade & Co. purchased in MO.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade and the crew are finally able to catch up with these elk despite some pretty terrible weather conditions. It comes right down to the wire! Dont miss it.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The "Trained Assassins" are back and its turkey season in the Midwest. In this first episode, Slade, Blake, and Ryan start in Missouri, run into some trouble, but end up getting it done on the first leg of the 2024 turkey tour.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade gets very busy in the real estate world. But lucky for him, Caleb Armstrong takes up the slack. Caleb sets out to hunt swamp bucks on the public land of Tensas Parish.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: On this weeks episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade and his daughter Asa take on the turkey woods together for the first time. As this is Asa's first time turkey hunting some quick pre hunt preparations are in order. Slade also was able to sit down with a good friend and registered forester to talk fire and the benefits of fire in land management. The next day, Asa and Slade were able to connect with a thundering tom as Asa punched her first ever turkey tag!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade is staying busy busy around the house, lots of testing on summer plots with Deergro and Backwoods bachelor pad blend. Also, there locally he takes a quick look at the new 60 acres he and Ryan bought as an investment property. Then ends with a throwback hunt from under the barn.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The team puts rubber to pavement and heads north to Montana. Tune in as they hit prime Fall fishing with the team at Fins & Feathers and get an inside look at the Adipose Boatworks shop. The excitement doesnt end there as the team gets challenged by serious mechanical problems with the Fly Shop Tour van and wind up stranded in Montana.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Leaving the van behind the team hits the road and finds themselves in Twin Bridges, Montana where they link up with Dan Rooster Leavens of Stonefly Outfitters for some of the best brown trout fishing you can find. The crew wraps up their visit to Montana with a trip to the team at Madison River Fishing Co. and an event to raise funds for the local Trout Unlimited chapter at MAP Brewing.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Bass fishing takes on numerous forms, from the simplicity of backyard pond fishing to the apex of competitive tournament angling. Yet, within this pursuit lies a distinct niche: trophy hunting via swimbait fishing. Unlike traditional baits, swimbaits stand out in their uniqueness within an angler's arsenal. Ranging from six to twelve-plus inches in length and weighing two to sixteen ounces, these baits require a quiver of specialized equipment and a different mindset. The adage "big bait, big fish" is the guiding principle, firmly centered on catching the biggest bass in the lake, armed with the largest baits from your tackle box.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Denny McMahan on this episode at the legendary Thumbtack Ranch in South Texas. Denny was nominated by his wife for Bucks for the Brave program hosted by Trinity Oaks. After dedicating his life to service in the US Army and law enforcement, he now continues the mission by teaching at the police academy. Denny is a true hero in his community - someone who sacrifices his time, his well being, and his life in service to others, never asking for anything in return.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Throughout the years, our friendships have been forged in deer camps across the country, and this week is a continuation of some of those times. This week, we have Dave Peterson and Mike Winkler from Do All Outdoors and Jurassic Rock in camp with us. When all is said and done, we even got to do a little hunting ourselves and create more memories that will last a lifetime

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Jennifer Brooks has spent her life answering the call to serve. From flying Blackhawk helicopters on multiple combat missions during two tours in Iraq to now serving as an Air Medical Pilot and first responder, her story is one of courage, sacrifice, and humility. In this episode of Storytellers, we join Jennifer in the field for a hunt that offers a rare moment to slow down, reflect, and honor a life dedicated to protecting others.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Blake Barnett alongside hunter Jimmy Reynolds as they take part in the 2nd Annual Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. This meaningful whitetail hunt is made possible by the great folks at Disabled Outdoorsmen. Jimmy settles in at the G2 Ranch in South Texas, where prime whitetail country and a shared passion for the outdoors set the stage for an unforgettable hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, its conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: With over 20 years of service, retiring as a Senior Chief Machinery Technician, Steven served abord multiple Coast Guard cutters, led critical missions, protected our nation's leaders, and earned the Coast Guard Achievement Medal for his outstanding service. Beyond the uniform, Steven has has spent decades giving back - coaching youth sports, mentoring young athletes, and living the values of service, leadership, and integrity. Steven's dedication didn't end with retirement - and neither does our gratitude. We were honored to have Steven at Thumbtack Ranch and are even more grateful for his service.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.desc: Capt. Blair tries for an upgrade off the coast of Naples.

programme.desc: A collection of the fish that didn't make the cut for an episode, so they get their own episode.

programme.desc: Kyle explores the Great Lakes on his Sea-Doo in search of walleye and lake trout.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and his buddy Jeremy set out on a buffalo hunt in the great state of Oklahoma. Along the way they learn about the true past and potential future of the American Buffalo from several interesting people with different perspectives.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel compares the performance of the High Flyer Series of Kicks choke tubes to help you determine which one is best for your duck hunting scenario.

programme.title: Black Cloud

Phillips was one of the original "Duck Men" in the classic Duck Commander Duck Men series with the Robertson family. On this hunt, W.E. tells stories of the old times and shares some CRAZY duck hunting strategies.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys move across the south hunting ducks in Texas and Oklahoma ahead of a major push of cold weather across the country.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: : Colder temps in the South bring two things: ducks and duck hunters. Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell are back in public timber, but so is the public. Will they get the hole? Will birds flare from sky busters? Find out on this week's episode.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtrees Colton Jordan brings down a banded mallard at Fowlers Point, a legendary duck hunting club in the heart of the Arkansas flyway.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck checks one off the bucket list. He's hunting gators for the first time.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew wraps up duck season in Louisiana.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Highlights from Dr. Duck and Billy's Duckcation in Washington. Dennis and Billy take a break every year during the Texas Split to hunt with Eagles Lakes Ranch. It is a good break from the public land duck hunting grind. Check out the highlights from this years trip.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didnt think it was.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: A beautiful beach day and confident anglers is the perfect scenario to prove tarpon never play by the rules. Justin & Meredith get a dose of tarpon psychology and begin to second guess their angling skills.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justins boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the worlds luckiest fish.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela is on a mission to better understand how wild-harvested protein contributes economically and culturally to society in North America. Join him as he learns more about the Wild Harvest Initiative and sets out to harvest his own food for the freezer.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Travelling to Vancouver Island, Dan Cabela meets with tribal leader Chief Cootes to learn more about how the careful management of black bears offers economic benefits while maintaining cultural importance to his community.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela joins conservationists in unraveling the complexity of human wildlife conflict and the reality of living with Africas apex predator - the Lion. While the Cabela Family Foundation undertakes the largest ever lion translocation.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela explains the domestic trade in exotic wildlife and how some of our planets most threatened species are being protected by the practice.

programme.title: The Waterdance
programme.desc: Injured in a climbing accident, writer Joel Garcia (Eric Stoltz) wakes up in a hospital having lost the use of his legs. Soon after, he's placed in a recovery ward where he begins the arduous process of rehabilitation and meets others with injuries like his own. Raymond (Wesley Snipes) is a ladies' man whose girl has nevertheless split, and Bloss (William Forsythe) is a rather prejudiced biker. Together, this unlikely trio helps one another to overcome the greatest challenge of their lives.

programme.title: Places in the Heart
programme.desc: This stirring drama follows a widow as she struggles to raise her two children and save her Texas farm during the Great Depression.

programme.title: Swept From the Sea
programme.desc: Amy, a servant girl, and Yanko, the sole survivor of a capsized ship bound for America, begin a fiery affair at the end of the nineteenth century.

programme.title: The Deep End of the Ocean
programme.desc: After Beth Cappadora's (Michelle Pfeiffer) youngest son, Ben, vanishes in Chicago, she slowly descends into a deep depression, affecting her husband, Pat (Treat Williams), and her other children (Jonathan Jackson, Alexa Vega). Relocating to Chicago several years later, they are shocked to discover a local boy named Sam (Ryan Merriman) who looks strikingly similar to Ben. Along with detective Candy Bliss (Whoopi Goldberg), the family must relive their trauma and find out the truth about Sam.

programme.title: In the Line of Fire
programme.desc: The story of a man looking to redeem himself by saving the life of America's highest elected official, even if it means sacrificing himself.

programme.title: 7 Seconds
programme.desc: Wesley Snipes stars as a skilled art thief who has to come up with a rescue plan when his partner is kidnapped in retaliation for their crimes.

programme.title: Felon
programme.desc: A suburban family man is convicted of manslaughter and sent to prison, where he becomes caught up in the vicious cycle of corruption and violence.

programme.title: Suspect
programme.desc: Kathleen is an overworked public defender who needs a vacation. Instead, she is given another case with no ordinary crime and no ordinary criminal.

programme.title: Lost & Found

programme.title: Wind
programme.desc: The open seas are ripe for adventure and romance as a man does his best to win the Americas Cup for the U.S. in a string of yacht races.

programme.title: Side Out
programme.desc: In this high-spirited tribute to the California lifestyle, its a summer of fun when Monroe and Zack hit Malibu Beach for a volleyball tournament.

programme.title: Every Time We Say Goodbye
programme.desc: When an American pilot meets a serene Jewish girl of Spanish descent during World War II, their diverse backgrounds might mean love could never work.

programme.title: Nothing in Common
programme.desc: A hilarious comedy about a perpetual adolescent who's forced to deal with his aging, unloving father when his mother leaves him flat.

programme.title: Philadelphia
programme.desc: A successful attorney fights back against the law firm that fired him after his colleagues learned he was gay and suffering from the AIDS virus.

programme.title: Where Angels Go...Trouble Follows
programme.desc: A bus trip for the girls of St. Francis Academy in Pennsylvania takes a radical detour on its way to an interfaith youth rally in California.

programme.title: Tight Spot
programme.desc: A lawyer springs a wise-cracking model from jail to convince her to testify against a no-good mobster, but a besotted cop throws a wrench in the plan.

programme.title: Boots Malone
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck jockey's agent takes a wealthy, yet neglected kid under his wing, and, with the help of others, turns him into a champion.

programme.title: Murderer's Row
programme.desc: Secret agent Matt Helm must rescue the kidnapped inventor of an ultra-destructive "helio beam" capable of destroying Washington, D.C.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf and His Lady
programme.desc: When a gem disappears from an exhibition, jewel-thief-turned-reporter Lone Wolf (Ron Randell) is accused.

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: A mute boy who spends his days roaming the English countryside starts coming out of his shell when he befriends a wild pony and a retired colonel.

programme.title: Jeanne Eagels
programme.desc: A look into the life of the celebrated Broadway actress who in 1922 made her name playing Sadie Thompson in Somerset Maugham's "Rain."

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Girl
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a switchboard operator, a daffy young woman tries her hand at door-to-door cosmetics sales only to get mixed up in a murder rap.

programme.title: Twentieth Century
programme.desc: When down-on-his-luck Broadway impresario Oscar Jaffe (John Barrymore) meets his discovery and former flame, Lily Garland (Carole Lombard), on the glamorous 20th Century Limited train between Chicago and New York, he uses every scheme at his disposal to win the movie star back both professionally and romantically. However, Lily, along with her new beau, George (Ralph Forbes), and Jaffe's rival producer, Max Jacobs (Charles Levison), who hired Lily to star in his latest play, have other plans.

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: During World War II, a dilapidated vessel, the Caine, gets a new ensign, Willis Keith (Robert Francis), and a new captain, Commander Queeg (Humphrey Bogart). The crew sees Queeg's unconventional behavior as irrational, and communications officer Thomas Keefer (Fred MacMurray) spreads suspicion about his suitability as captain. When a dire situation during a storm forces the executive officer (Van Johnson) to relieve Queeg of his duties, he and Ensign Keith are tried for mutiny.

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: A youth leader and idealist fights false accusations and corruption from the political machine that engineered his appointment to the U.S. Senate.

programme.title: Duffy
programme.desc: A professional smuggler gets involved in a scheme by two half-brothers to steal a fortune from their wealthy fathers yacht in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: American Madness
programme.desc: During the Depression, the bank owned by generous Dickson (Walter Huston) is barely staying afloat, and things get worse when $100,000 is lifted from the vault. Fingers are pointed at reformed crook Matt (Pat O'Brien), who got a job and a fresh start from Dickson. The innocent Matt can clear his name by admitting that on the night of the robbery he was breaking up a tryst between Dickson's wife and another teller. But this revelation may crush Dickson, and Matt's conscience plays tug-of-war.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton
programme.desc: A butler becomes a king after a shipwreck.

programme.title: Phffft!
programme.desc: A divorced couple hopes to move on after their split, but fate has other plans. Theyre dating other people, but they keep running into each other!

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!
programme.desc: In this 1953 musical remake of The Awful Truth, a recently-divorced couple try every way to make each other jealous.

programme.title: A Woman of Distinction
programme.desc: To garner publicity for the college, a press agent plants a story in the press about a torrid affair between an icy dean and a visiting professor.

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: The Guns of Navarone
programme.desc: Based on the book by Alistair MacLean.

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: Based on Peter George's book "Red Alert."

programme.title: The White Squaw
programme.desc: A Swedish settler (David Brian) starts a war when he tries to drive Dakotas off their Wyoming reservation.

programme.title: Go West, Young Lady
programme.desc: A vicious outlaw called Pecos Pete (Onslow Stevens) has long tormented the peaceful residents of a small frontier town. So these desperate people hire a dedicated new sheriff, Tex Miller (Glenn Ford), to bring this ruffian to justice. But, for all his determination, Tex is tricked by Pete and led into an ambush. Ultimately, it is the wily and brassy transplant Belinda "Bill" Pendergast (Penny Singleton) who uncovers Pete's true identity and plots a way to run him out of town once and for all.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: The conniving Ed Barker (Dick Curtis) murders a rancher and tries to steal the ranch from his widow, Jean Andrews (Ann Doran). However, their old friend Cliff Houston (Charles Starrett) appears on the scene to try and save the day. He makes a deal with Barker and his crew to drive the Andrews herd to market and split the money, but each man really plans to con the other as soon as the time is right. Along for the ride is singing cowboy Bob Stevens (Bob Nolan).

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: Buck and the Preacher
programme.desc: A trail guide who protects former slaves and a con-man join forces against bounty hunters hired to drive the former slaves back into the south.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A banished gunfighter (Audie Murphy) returns to his sweetheart (Merry Anders) and helps his sheriff friend (James Best) face outlaws.

programme.title: A Tornado in the Saddle
programme.desc: Ranchers and a new sheriff (Russell Hayden) have trouble with a gold rush.

programme.title: Streets of Ghost Town
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his sidekick (Smiley Burnette) look for stolen gold with a history.

programme.title: Secret of Treasure Mountain
programme.desc: An Apache curse hangs over good guys (Valerie French, William Prince) and a villain (Raymond Burr) seeking Spanish gold.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: The Black Dakotas
programme.desc: A Confederate plot to turn the Sioux against the Union crumbles when a double agent makes off with a shipment of gold.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: Battle of Rogue River
programme.desc: A cavalry major (George Montgomery) makes peace with Indians despite an agitator (Richard Denning) working for carpetbaggers.

programme.title: A Man Called Sledge
programme.desc: In the Old West, a gunfighting outlaw connives his way into a jail with the goal of stealing a large shipment of gold stored in the prison.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) tries to stop an Army scout and a band of outlaws from starting an American Indian war.

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men
programme.desc: Rancher John Stewart (Randolph Scott) prefers to to resolve problems without falling back on violent solutions. However, fellow cattleman Wick Campbell (Richard Boone) isn't so peaceful, and he hires a team of armed mercenaries, led by ruthless Frank Scavo (Leo Gordon), to rid him of any possible competition. After narrowly surviving an attack from Scavo and his men, Stewart has little choice but to fight back in order to save both his ranch and his family, including nephew Howie (Skip Homeier).

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: Gunga Din
programme.desc: Three British soldiers seek treasure during an uprising in India.

programme.title: Bullitt
programme.desc: Steve McQueen is an officer unraveling the mafia ties behind a shooting.

programme.title: Wild Rovers
programme.desc: An aging cowboy joins up with a beginner to rob banks.

programme.title: Dodge City
programme.desc: A soldier of fortune takes on the corrupt boss of a western town.

programme.title: The Goodbye Girl
programme.desc: A divorced mother finds love when she's forced to share an apartment.

programme.title: Please Don't Eat the Daisies
programme.desc: A drama critic and his family try to adjust to life in the country.

programme.title: Footlight Parade
programme.desc: A producer fights labor problems to put on a show.

programme.title: A Night at the Opera
programme.desc: The Marx Brothers run wild through the world of opera in this classic.

programme.title: The Rise and Fall of Legs Diamond
programme.desc: A small-time thief kills his way to the top of the New York rackets.

programme.title: Mutiny on the Bounty
programme.desc: A first mate leads his crew in mutiny against their sadistic captain.

programme.title: The Philadelphia Story
programme.desc: A socialite's first husband shows up on the eve of her second marriage.

programme.title: What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?
programme.desc: Two fading actress-sisters whose relationship takes a dangerous turn.

programme.title: Viva Las Vegas
programme.desc: A driver preparing for the Grand Prix whiles his time away in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Logan's Run
programme.desc: An officer uncovers the deadly secret behind a society that worships youth.

programme.title: The Roaring Twenties
programme.desc: Three war veteran friends start a bootlegging business in New York.

programme.title: Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo
programme.desc: Jimmy Doolittle trains troops for the first airborne attacks on Japan.

programme.title: The Great Race
programme.desc: Rival drivers compete in a 22,000-mile New York-to-Paris auto race.

programme.title: The Outfit
programme.desc: An ex-con takes on the mob to avenge his brother's death.

programme.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
programme.desc: Milly teaches the seven Pontipee brothers how to find wives.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett and Five-0 take on the mob when a former boss is killed; Junior's friend is on the run after witnessing the murder.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett joins Junior and his SEAL team on a mission to capture an elusive person who is holding his mentor hostage; Gerard Hirsch and Kamekona help Grover and Tani on a murder case involving art stolen by Nazis during World War II.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: The Phoenix must recover the body of a pilot whose plane crashed while testing an experimental laser mapping system that MacGyver designed; Riley tries to identify the hacker who tricked a SWAT team into arresting her and Elwood.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: MacGyver and the team are asked to solve a locked-door mystery when a man working inside a remote, ultra-secure international seed vault disappears.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: When Nicholas Helman resurfaces to carry out a killing spree, the team is forced to get help from the one person who knows him best -- his protg, Murdoc.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: MacGyver and Desi help a group of Syrian refugees who are being pursued by human traffickers; Bozer is trapped in Oversight's car, and it's rigged to explode.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Two American tourists go missing while doing a scavenger hunt through some of the world's most dangerous countries; the Phoenix team goes under cover as backpackers to find them and bring them home alive.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: A cunning new adversary's carefully crafted plans force Mac to make an impossible choice: save the life of a friend or save the lives of hundreds of innocents; Mac receives new information that will drive a wedge between him and his father.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Matty's ex-husband, Ethan, asks her for help when a criminal organization kidnaps his wife and daughter; Matty must decide if she's willing to commit treason to help Ethan; Riley joins Billy Colton and Mama Colton on a mission to Paris.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Ex-MI6 agent Russ Taylor recruits former Phoenix Foundation members Mac, Riley, Bozer, Matty and Desi to hunt down a bioweapon that's planned to be used by a mysterious organization for a devastating attack on a major US city.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Hotch is arrested by a SWAT team and suspected of conspiracy; when the team members scramble to prove Hotch's innocence, they discover a larger plot may be on the horizon.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: New recruit Luke Alvez helps the team capture a killer who escaped from prison with 12 other convicts.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: J.J. is shaken after investigating the case of two abducted children, and tells her husband about the events.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: As the BAU welcomes back Emily Prentiss, they're called upon to investigate the disappearance of three women.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team searches for a serial killer along the Appalachian Trail in rural Virginia.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU investigates the case of two murdered families, where two high school students are the sole survivors.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Three children vanish while riding their bikes on the same path where a similar unsolved disappearance took place 30 years earlier.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A man who believes himself to be the brother of Dr. Tara Lewis arrives in town, knowing everything about Tara's family; Tara is unable to make contact with her real brother.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team investigates when the remains of a dozen people are discovered along a creek bed in Yakima, Wash.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: While conducting a profiling course on his birthday, Rossi gets a call from serial killer Tommy Yates, who gives him the location of his latest victim.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates when home invasions involving casualties strike upscale neighborhoods in San Diego.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU investigates when a bizarre hieroglyph is found under a deceased homeless man's armpit; Reid decides to take his mother out of a clinical study early to bring her home.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team is called in to investigate when male bodies are discovered that seem to be impossible to identify.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When a BAU member gets in trouble in Mexico, the team enlists the services of the International Response Team for help.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU looks into the cause of several fatal car crashes involving drivers and pedestrians; Reid gets bad news.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU investigates a series of disfiguring acid attacks on young men and women; Dr. Reid begins to settle into his new surroundings.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team searches for a group of video gamers that has started to play the game in real life, killing police officers, stealing evidence, raping women, and robbing a bank.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and his team investigate the murder of a suspected drug lord as one member of the group is arrested for buying marijuana.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: New technology helps find the true rapist in a cold case, but he is murdered before he can go to trial.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man is murdered while trying to learn how to pick up women at a hip Miami nightclub.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a female executive is shot at an afternoon concert, the evidence leads the team to suspect that the dreaded Mala Noche gang has struck again.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Evidence shows that a series of murders is linked to organized crime, but it also leads Horatio and the team to a pair of film students whose screenplay mirrors the details of the crimes.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a body is found during a beach volleyball tournament, the evidence leads Horatio to his nemesis, Walter Resden, who is now targeting a person Horatio has sworn to protect.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A convicted child molester is found murdered in Alexx's neighborhood.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: As their murder investigation intensifies, Horatio must ask Natalia to reveal a secret from her past to help solve the case.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a corpse is recovered, the team finds evidence against a man formerly vindicated of killing his wife and dumping her body in the ocean.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio must protect Marisol when her life is threatened after she witnesses a robbery.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSI team must find whoever is trying to kill a couple recently released from jail, whose misdeeds turned them into media darlings.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When the remains of a woman from a wealthy family are found in a national park, the team thinks she may be a victim of the Ghost Killer; Booth's career might be in for some changes.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When the head swim coach of a community college is found dead at the bottom of the well, possible suspects think he may have been having an affair; a new intern (Laura Spencer) catches Sweets' attention.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A man who wanted to talk to Booth about a possible government cover-up is killed before their meeting takes place; as Booth and the team investigate the conspiracy surrounding the man's death, Booth's future with the FBI becomes uncertain.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Skeletal remains found at the bottom of a lake turn out to be those of a congressman's former aide.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When Dr. Brennan uncovers the identity of a man killed while driving a car registered to a prominent Middle Eastern man with ties to the U.S. government, she and Booth find themselves tracking a terrorist.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a dark conspiracy to reveal how far people will go to escape the end of the world.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Gated estate Challis Court is a tight-knit community for retired police officers, but when a new arrival is found dead, the other residents regard the murder as an affront. Barnaby realizes that the killer is likely an ex-police officer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Pastry chef Chrissie Larkton's mill has been in her family for centuries. She restored it and turned it into a thriving online business, but the popularity has overshadowed Lower Blissingham, and many of the villagers are not happy about it.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Elverton-Cum-Latterly battle in the Dominoes Competition that dates back decades, but when the event occurs the same night as a drag queen fundraiser for a terminally ill teenager, it results in a deadly clash of cultures.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When MATTHEW DRAPER, a quarry worker is killed by a demolition charge after obeying the orders of his foreman, IAN FRASER, to return to the unexploded device, no one can predict how it might effect the tranquil village of Fletcher's Cross nine years later...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's aunt, Alice Bly (Phyllis Calvert), has an addiction to detective stories, a deep admiration for her favourite nephew, and is recovering from an operation at the Lawnside Nursing Home. When a resident dies, Alice Bly picks up gossip which, mixed with the detective fiction with which she is passing the hours, makes her think that all is not as it should be at Lawnside.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The village of Midsomer Mallow is one of the villages hoping to win the title of the "Perfect English Village" competition. As the story unfolds, not everything is "perfect" as local thief Peter Drinkwater is stabbed with a pitchfork at an abandoned farm, he's using as a squat. Shortly after robbing a retired actor's home. Despite the villagers' best efforts to keep the murder quiet so as to not ruin their chances in the competition, several further deaths occur eventually bringing Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby back several decades to uncover the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst the Upper Marshwood hunt assemble outside the village inn, a filthy tramp-like man leaves the shop and skulks into the wood. Soon after, he hears the sound of the hunt begin and the unforgettable noise of the horses and hounds in hot pursuit of the fox. Running for cover, towards the safety of his home-made shelter, he stumbles and falls into a pit - screaming. LIZA, isolated in the disused railway carriage which constitutes her home, moves deeper into the wood having heard the scream. She finds the pit and sees the tramp lying crumpled on the ground, clearly dead. She stares at him for a moment, then turns and walks away.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Undertaker Patrick Pennyman is found dead with his wrists slashed and suspicion turns towards a spiritualist church.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: During a regatta, the body of Rowing Club chairman Guy Sweetman is found bludgeoned and drowned. Bachelor Sweetman was prolifically promiscuous and jealousy would seem to be the motive.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott follow a trail of dead people involved in the collecting of rare orchids.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A four-member syndicate owns a racehorse that two of them are desperate to sell and two of them are determined to keep. When one of them is murdered, Barnaby is on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Barnaby and Sgt. Scott investigate the death of John Ransom in the village of Midsomer Mere. He had just been ejected from a pub for fighting but the post mortem shows a series of burn marks on his skull indicating he may have been subject to electric shock.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Sleepy Goodman's Land is known as the Greenest Village in Midsomer. But when the entire village is bought by a Texas oilman, a string of grisly murders ensues.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a corporate giant tries to acquire a small but respected relish factory owned and run by a dysfunctional family, a naked body is found in the warehouse.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Deaths follow the discovery of a valuable musical manuscript sold cheaply at an auction.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The demise of the Shirewell patriarch sparks a vicious inheritance dispute when eldest son Lucian announces plans to break up an estate that's been in his family for centuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the author of a book that sparked a nationwide treasure hunt is found dead, Barnaby and Winter must unravel the cryptic clues to find the killer among a group of dedicated seekers.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After a pet detective turns up dead inside the kennel of a dog he was searching for, Barnaby and Winter are drawn into the world of dognapping, cat seduction, and animal investigation.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Troubled solicitor Nick Turner falls from the roof of his home, is this suicide disguised as murder?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for 400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Hollywood Divas
programme.desc: Paula pushes Forrest to be more involved with group project. Things get out of control and tempers flare when the ladies confront Forrest without Paula. programme.title: The One
programme.desc: The house wakes up in a frenzy as the daters learn from Mieka that Brent shared his bed with one of the ladies. With the first elimination looming, will the recent events influence Brent and Ashleys decisions on who they send home?

programme.title: The One
programme.desc: The guys wake up to learn that Ashley is nowhere to be found. Meanwhile, Brent is living his best life doing a steamy yoga session and connecting with the ladies. Eventually, Ashley returns but has some explaining to do before Eliminations.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Kadeem Hardison is best known for his iconic portrayal of Dwayne Wayne on the hit television show A Different World. Kadeem gets uncensored to talk about playing a beloved character on the show that influenced a generation.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Tyson Beckford is one of the first black male supermodels; Tyson breaks down his complex childhood that could've led him to prison, but led him to Ralph Lauren Instead.

programme.title: Unsung
programme.desc: Will Downing is the Prince of Sophisticated Soul, with a 30-year career that includes chart topping singles in Dance, R&B, and Jazz. But at the height of his career, a paralyzing bout with auto-immune disease threatened his life.

programme.title: White Water
programme.desc: White Water is the story of a 7 year-old black kid in segregated 1963 Opelika, Alabama who becomes obsessed with the desire to taste the water from the "white's only" drinking fountain and sets out on a quest to do the unthinkable: drink from it.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Kirk Franklin was raised by his aunt. It was there that he discovered his love for music through the church. With the faith and support of his family he remains true to his spiritual journey and to inspire faith through his music and his testimony.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Hailing from Las Vegas, Nevada, Shaffer was raised by a single mother. Ne-Yo found out how important being a strong father figure would be. Taking opportunities as a songwriter he was able to build a career before landing a record deal.

programme.title: Unsung

programme.title: Unsung

programme.title: Hollywood Divas

programme.title: Hollywood Divas
programme.desc: Lisas throws a mothers brunch to celebrate her mom who has cancer. Paula revisits her homeless past. Countess starts working on her vocals again with Warryn Campell, while Golden puts her business hat on with her pillow line and photo shoot.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Tempers flare as the logging season hits the rails. Jay Browning battles allergic shock, while Gabe Rygaard sends one of the greenhorns packing.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: At Rygaard, one of the greenhorns goes AWOL, and Gabe has him on the chopping block. But he's not the only one; several loggers face the ax.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers struggle to get back on track after losing a man. At Browning, a weak cable threatens to kill half the crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby's desperate dash for cash is halted when he crashes in the swamp. A monster gator stalks the S&S boys, pushing Jimmy to his breaking point.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jimmy and James come face-to-face with the 12-foot gator that has stalked them for weeks. In the swamps of Louisiana, Shelby goes solo on a challenging mission.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Dave returns from jail but may not have a job to come back to; Shelby hunts his biggest catch of the season.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: With only two weeks remaining in the season, the mountain is turned upside down. Browning bounces back, while Rygaard suffers a devastating loss.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle pick an over-the-top, tiki-party-meets-rockabilly home; Frank and Robbie set their sights on a vast collection hidden in the fortified bunkers of an old army base.

programme.title: American Pickers

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys have high hopes when they uncover a 1935 Auburn roadster on an Indiana farm, but end up with just a kiddie ride instead.

programme.desc: It's tattoo mania in New York as Mike and Danielle pick through an artist's high-end collection of flash art; in Ohio, Frank and Robbie bumble through four stories of junk in search of hidden treasures.

programme.desc: Mike and Danielle crawl into a Pittsburgh time capsule, while Frank and Robbie plow through six generations of stuff on one of Michigan's oldest farms.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil discovers more beaver activity on the Robertson land, he recruits Jase, Jep, and Si to get rid of them. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie bring Bella to her first day of karate practice.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Stumped on a way to celebrate Willie's birthday, Korie enlists the guys' help and Jase takes the reigns in planning a trip to the lake where Phil and Kay used to live.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie takes a business trip to Scotland to expand his duck call business, he brings the entire family along so they can reconnect with their Scottish roots.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A special holiday episode of Duck Dynasty shows when the Robertson family took over the Thanksgiving special of a local TV show "Good Morning Arklamiss."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes the temporary owner of a thoroughbred, he and the guys take it to a local track and enter it into a race.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons help a long time employee whose Mom has fallen on hard times by buying her a brand new house for Christmas. Jep, Jase, Martin and Godwin race to finish a deck in time for the big reveal, only to get sidetracked by a hammering competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase enters an outhouse race to help promote Willie's Duck Diner, but when the Robertsons show up for the race, they face an unexpected rival -- Phillip McMillan. Meanwhile, Willie attempts to create the world's greatest bologna sandwich for his Duck Diner menu, and enlists the help of the ladies to be his "taste testers."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie helps Sadie with her homework by enlisting the guys to create a real-life version of a math problem, but when Jase and Willie get sidetracked helping Sadie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep asks Willie and the guys to help move his old chicken coop into his new house, which is under renovation, Jessica takes issue with its appearance, leading the guys to yet another project.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes an assistant coach on Lil' Will's struggling football team, his authority is tested when the kids challenge the adults to a scrimmage. Meanwhile, Kay brings Jep and Si to an aquarobics class at a local health club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys transform an old pontoon boat into a floating duck blind, they are faced with the impending question of whether or not it will actually float. Meanwhile, when Kay's dog Bobo misbehaves, Willie signs Kay and Bobo up for a doggie obedience class.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep and Jessica move into Willie and Jase's neighborhood, Jep is sidelined with an illness, causing Willie and the Robertson family to pitch in and help Jessica get her new house ready in time for Jep's arrival home.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and the guys take John Luke golfing prior to his engagement party, their attempts at marital advice don't exactly work out as planned.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase receives a palate of fireworks as a gift, he and the guys create a homemade fireworks display for the Robertson family 4th of July barbeque. Meanwhile, Uncle Si is honored by the veterans association and given his own exhibit at a local military museum.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil and Jase get into an argument about which type of duck decoy works best, Jase and the guys repaint some old decoys, betting that Phil cannot tell the difference. Meanwhile, Jessica challenges Willie to a bowling contest with Kay's "Big Sista's" club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys discover they have a knack for removing pests from other people's property, they use their new talents to their advantage. Meanwhile, Willie gives Sadie and John Luke summer jobs at his diner, but first he must train them to be good employees.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When an office prank war spirals out of control, Phil volunteers Willie, Jase, and Jep to help Alan at the church, which seems more like a punishment than charity work. Meanwhile, Korie gives Kay a surprise art class taught by famous artist Pierre Matisse.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the guys spend the weekend at a hunting cabin to celebrate Martin's bachelor party, things turns explosive after they find a cache of antique black powder weapons. Meanwhile, Willie helps Kay fulfill her lifelong dream of owning a petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Uncle Si has a brush with death, he creates a bucket list and asks the guys to help him fulfill his dreams. Meanwhile, Kay sets out to prove to Willie and Alan that she actually graduated high school.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Duck Commander sponsors a NASCAR race, Jase and the guys get themselves in the mood by attempting to work as a pit crew. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie challenge John Luke and his fianc Mary Kate to a doubles tennis match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this very special wedding episode, John Luke Robertson is getting married to his fianc Mary Kate, and our cameras are with him every step of the way.

programme.desc: When Missy's parents visit, her father convinces Jase to take him on a quail hunt. But while their "bonding hunt" yields very few quail, it does bring them closer together as friends.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the family visit the Rockies for a little work and lot of fun.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is going to be the keynote speaker at the annual Profession Bail Agents convention in Las Vegas, but before he leaves he's got to clear two cases from his docket--Heidi and Stephanie. Heidi is a check forger who's failed to make a court appearance.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has two fugitives to catch, and he gets help from the unlikeliest sources--the fugitives' mothers. First, Ginger's mother wants to revoke her daughter's bond because 18-year-old Ginger is selling drugs and running wild.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's been raining for days and the team is going a little stir crazy. Dog however has the cure--a good hunt. Maui has failed to appear on a drug charge and the team has just one lead.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A Hawaiian surfing hero is on a wave to nowhere and it's Dog's turn to play lifeguard. "Buttons," known throughout the islands for his prowess on the waves and his daring 360's, has wiped-out on the rocky shoals of drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Michael is out on bail for drug sales, theft, and violation of parole. Dog's after him for failing to appear in court and his only lead is Jen, his co-signer and girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog told him not to go, but Charles went anyway, skipping to Oregon against the terms of his bail. Now Dog has a tip that Charles plans to slip back into Honolulu. With $30,000 on the line Dog knows he can leave little to chance.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the team isn't pulling any punches, literally or figuratively! In between tracking down a potentially dangerous ex-con facing a five year stretch in the big house, Leland is struggling to find time to train.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that crime and drugs not only damage victims but also harm the families of the perpetrators, especially the kids. And both of the fugitives he's chasing today have left shattered families and struggling women in their wake.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that it is better to give than to receive, so when a fellow bondsman grieving for his recently departed spouse requests his help, he jumps into action. Studying the fugitive's file the team uncovers a surprising fact.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog believes that the family that plays together stays together. But what happens when a family's idea of fun is getting high and running amuck? Today's case is a twofer, a brother and sister both charged with drug related offenses.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Tim's got a big problem on his hands. One of his clients, Owen, has failed to appear in court. He's on bond for serious drug charges and now Tim could lose $30,000 if he doesn't catch Owen.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: As Dog likes to say, "it's not the years it's the miles," and this goes for both men and machines. Those long hunts and the rides to jail take a toll not only on Dog but also on his vehicles.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Roger has 27 prior arrests, spent years in jail and doesn't want to go back. But he's missed court and now Dog has to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's got a twofer on his hands, but the cases couldn't be more different. The first is a woman whose family wants her back in jail, the other is a former choirboy whose family ties are strong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Denver and in hot pursuit of a woman wanted for identity theft. The sad reality is that the identify which has been robbed is her own. She's traded in a bright future for a life on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Going after two fugitives in one day is tough enough without the facing Colorado's notoriously unpredictable weather. Today it's the threat of sever thunderstorm, hail and area wide tornado warnings.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the posse travel to the Big Island to help Leland track down a small-time Bonnie and Clyde couple. Their crime: theft, including allegedly stealing a pair of Buddha statues for resale. But this only masks deeper problems with the couple.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The "Big Island" of Hawaii boasts both lush tropical splendor and stark volcanic beauty. But today Dog and the team can't spend much time taking in the sights, they need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive is hard to pin down in Honolulu's downtown district--moving from hostel to hotel to apartment high-rise. But as the hunt evolves, Dog discovers that this alleged burglar isn't the only family member wanted by the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target today seems to have a taste for drugs and a record of reckless driving. The hunt has deep emotional resonance for the team because today is the anniversary of the fatal car accident of Dog's daughter Barbara Katie.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Tim's got a big problem on his hands. One of his clients, Owen, has failed to appear in court. He's on bond for serious drug charges and now Tim could lose $30,000 if he doesn't catch Owen.
